intro: Cicerbita garrettii, commonly known as the Garrett's bittercress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are yellow and produce small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds.
